DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Target Anatomic Site Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A result of a clinical observation, i.e. from an examination, test or direct observation performed on the subject. EXAMPLE(S): The performed observation of "WBC count" would be associated to a clinical result called "WBC result" in which the results of the observation (13000 WBCs) would be stored. A coded value specifying the anatomic location that is the focus of an observation result. EXAMPLE(S): Arm for skin rash. NOTE(S): The target site of the result may be different than the target site of the activity (PerformedObservation) that generated it. A chest x-ray (observation) has the target site of chest while the result might show an infiltration in the left lower lobe of the lung (target site of result), or a dermatological exam may check the skin across the whole body (target site of observation) while the result might identify a rash on the right leg (target site of result).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Target Anatomic Site Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
